channel.title: Looking for a good clean client
channel.description:
I have not been active in this community or any other RS community for that matter. I have decided to step back into the scene and mess around a little. I was just wondering: Could someone forward me to a decent server/client that is CLEAN and STABLE.
What do I mean?
I am looking for a client with the following: 1) Dupe's fixed 2) Bug's fixed 3) Glitch's fixed 4) Stable server (does not go spastic and laggy when 30 people are online)
What would I prefer to be already included? 1) A basic control panel 2) Webclient files 3) The ability to add custom items
What graphics or revision? Preferably the new interfaces.
Please do not flame/troll as that is not what I am looking for.
ONLY reply if you have a link for me OR if you are willing to help me when I get into difficulties. I am willing to pay for help, however I will not pay for the client or server.

item.title: Looking for a good clean client
item.dc:creator: @wize_wizerd5 wize wizerd5
item.description:
@wize_wizerd5 wrote:

Christmas_tree:

Requests are not allowed.

Sorry, just seeking advice. Where am I allowed to post this?

Currently going through hell finding a good base with very few bugs/glitches/dupes etc. Most links are broken in the server download section.

Again I apologise if this is in the wrong section, I am not familiar with the rules. I have just gone through and read them.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a good clean client

[quote=“luna-scape, post:6, topic:477446”]I can talk to you later on skype i aint home now.
But if u look in server downliads u will see a lot of cool stuff[/quote]

Yeah been looking for a while, quite a lot of rubbish. When I do find something good the links are down.

item.title: Looking for a good clean client
item.dc:creator: @wize_wizerd5 wize wizerd5
item.description:
@wize_wizerd5 wrote:

[quote=“luna-scape, post:4, topic:477446”]Control panel is server sided?
Cleaned clients are most of the time not webclient ready.
Ever cluent has the ability to add custom items but sometimes you have to decrompress files.
(models.idx/dat)
Idont get what u mean with graphics or revision since u need the same revision as your source. Dupes and bugs and glutch are almost always server sided asswell[/quote]

Added on skype we’ll talk there

I know control panel is server sided
I am looking for a clean client that is webclient ready (so to some extent not clean I guess?)
By graphics/revision I mean 317 etc.
I want a server/client that has many dupe/bug/glitch fixes as it makes my job easier.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a good clean client

item.title: Looking for a good clean client
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Control panel is server sided?
Cleaned clients are most of the time not webclient ready.
Ever cluent has the ability to add custom items but sometimes you have to decrompress files.
(models.idx/dat)
Idont get what u mean with graphics or revision since u need the same revision as your source. Dupes and bugs and glutch are almost always server sided asswell

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a good clean client

item.title: Looking for a good clean client
item.dc:creator: @wize_wizerd5 wize wizerd5
item.description:
@wize_wizerd5 wrote:

[quote=“luna-scape, post:2, topic:477446”]Wrong section (im not even sure if this is allowed.)
Oke step 1:
Open google.com (this is the hardest part)
Step2:
Search cleaned pi (make sure u type it in the search box)
Step 3:
Look at the topics and chose ur client.(now comes tge tricky part)
Step 3:
Click download :o (make sure u click the right button.)

Anyways fixing yourself shit is much better.[/quote]

ONLY reply if you have a link for me

Please read. I know how to google and I am currently searching.
HOWEVER it is easier to ask while searching. I don’t have much experience with RS as I haven’t had anything to do with RS for years now. Hence I am asking around on the forums to find out what others think is a good stable base.
Please leave out useless comments.

Read full topic
